OOC: I wrote a reply yesterday, but I never showed up... Stupid Yahoo...

Bic:

Krhinos: There are some Dynamite Fairies inside and a Collosus Drill
too. It'll all make the job easier. Dracon, man the engines. Start
them up and be ready in 20 cycles. Rukus, you're on the transwarp
drives. I'll plot the course and transmit it to you. Make sure we've
got enough power. I'm going to be on the bridge to pilot the base.
Call me if there's anything. We leave when we're all done.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "LurkerAbyss" <1641coburn@r...> wrote:
> OOC: Yep, ditto for me.
> 
> BIC:
> 
> Dracon smiles as he stares into the exterior void as well.  He walks
over to Rukus and slaps a hand on his shoulder gruffly.
> 
> "This is it," he says confidently, "this is our big break."
>   ----- Original Message ----- 
>   From: Jeff 
>   To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
>   Sent: Monday, June 09, 2003 9:05 PM
>   Subject: StarDrill Corp.
> 
> 
>   ooc: s'all good ^^ -- i changed the msg subject, so it's easier to 
>   pick out of the list ^^
> 
>   --Rukus--
> 
>   Rukus nods to Krhinos, "I anticipate our arrival. I have a feeling 
>   that we will see action on this trip. As long as there is no 
>   treachery from within, we can deal with anything."
> 
>   He gazes out the view portal into the vast expanse. <<Here we go... 
>   money's money, and this should provide lots of it...>>
> 
> 
>   --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic" <Proudwing500k@h...> wrote:
>   > OOC: I'll speed things up a little, sorry if Jeff or Lurker feel 
>   bad
>   > about it. I'll just state the whole thing and assume your chars are
>   > inside.
>   > 
>   > Bic:
>   > 
>   > Krhinos composed a confidential code on the lift panel that would 
>   lead
>   > them to the docking bay of the massive corporate station. All the
>   > while, he briefed his two crewmembers.
>   > 
>   > Krhinos: We're going to prehistoric Earth at around the era of the
>   > Beast Wars. The precise period is supposed to be free of any 
>   conflict,
>   > but you're better safe than sorry. Anyhow, we mine for anything we
>   > can, processing it and sending it back. I've even received
>   > authorization to use our special "dynamite fairies"... Quite 
>   effective
>   > a drilling method, I might say. We tested them on Asteroid Tykus...
>   > which happens not to exist anymore. If I'm right, there's likely 
>   to be
>   > tons of energon there. Whether it's stable or not, I don't know, 
>   but
>   > it's worth billions as we speak! So, gentlemen, embark the station 
>   and
>   > prepare it. We depart as soon as we're done.
>   > 
>   > With that, the doors opened and revealed a huge mobile station that
>   > waited only to go across space...
>   > 
>   > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "LurkerAbyss" <1641coburn@r...> 
>   wrote:
>   > > Dracon slips into the elevator, staying silent and simply 
>   listening
>   > in on the conversation.
>   > >   ----- Original Message ----- 
>   > >   From: Nic 
>   > >   To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
>   > >   Sent: Friday, June 06, 2003 11:02 PM
>   > >   Subject: Re: The new Contract
>   > > 
>   > > 
>   > >   Krhinos entered an elevator and signaled his two other 
>   companions to
>   > >   follow him.
>   > > 
>   > >   Krhinos: No matter. They must all have been too drunk to notice
>   > >   anyways. The point is, though, that we are going on a mission 
>   and we
>   > >   bring in a full mining and processing station with us. Outpost 
>   on
>   > >   planet, space relay. In short, the full monty! This is one 
>   heck of a
>   > >   contract!
>   > > 
>   > >   --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Jeff" <x_rauq_x@y...> wrote:
>   > >   > --Rukus--
>   > >   > 
>   > >   > "Lead on. Keep an eye out for tails." Rukus eyes the crowd 
>   as he 
>   > >   > speaks. No bots attracted notice under his careful scrutiny, 
>   but 
>   > >   > that didn't mean anything. "We weren't being descrete, so 
>   unwelcome 
>   > >   > eyes may have wavered our way."
>   > >   > 
>   > >   > 
>   > >   > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "LurkerAbyss" 
>   <1641coburn@r...>
>   > wrote:
>   > >   > > Dracon made no gestures and remained blank in the face, 
>   almost to 
>   > >   > the point of appearing to be sinister.
>   > >   > > 
>   > >   > > "If it's important...then let's go," he said, agreeing 
>   with 
>   > >   > Krhinos, "we should discuss this ordeal furthermore amongst 
>   > >   > ourselves..."
>   > >   > >   ----- Original Message ----- 
>   > >   > >   From: Nic 
>   > >   > >   To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
>   > >   > >   Sent: Thursday, June 05, 2003 10:26 PM
>   > >   > >   Subject: Re: The new Contract
>   > >   > > 
>   > >   > > 
>   > >   > >   Krhinos watched the lithe bot come close and sneaking 
>   past the 
>   > >   > crowd.
>   > >   > > 
>   > >   > >   Krhinos: Rukus, right? Good then. I guess this is the 
>   whole of 
>   > >   > the
>   > >   > >   crew. I'd tell you more about this mission, but not in 
>   here.
>   > Too 
>   > >   > many
>   > >   > >   ears and I don't trust about all of them. Suffice it to 
>   say,
>   > your
>   > >   > >   paycheck is sitting calmly on the mobile station and you 
>   are 
>   > >   > eligible
>   > >   > >   to 3.75% of the profits we make on this operation. The 
>   number 
>   > >   > might
>   > >   > >   seem low, but wait for the real thing! Now come along 
>   and let's 
>   > >   > go
>   > >   > >   somewhere more private.
>   > >   > > 
>   > >   > >   Ironically, he was saying this precise sentence in the 
>   precise 
>   > >   > place
>   > >   > >   and to the precise poeple in which circumstances it 
>   seemed 
>   > >   > weird. In
>   > >   > >   fact, one of the pleasure bots was saying the same thing 
>   to a 
>   > >   > drunken
>   > >   > >   miner who was nearly passed out on the floor. Lucky for 
>   her,
>   > the 
>   > >   > guy
>   > >   > >   had already paid her, twice rather than once, drunk as 
>   he was.
>   > >   > >
